titleStmt.title: Description of Columbia University X892.8 M311: Calligraphy samples in Persian

See the Creative Commons Public Domain Mark page for usage details, http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/.

This work is published from: United States. For a summary of CC0, see https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/. Legal code: https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/legalcode.

msContents.summary: Set of examples of calligraphy in Persian; two leaves in Sanskrit (f. 31v-32r); leaves are written on one side only; most examples are labeled.

textLang.#text: Persian with two leaves in Sanskrit; colophon in Urdu

supportDesc.extent: ii, 42, i leaves : 183 x 115 (112 x 67) mm, bound to 192 x 115 mm

layoutDesc.layout: Various; leaves numbered in Hindu-Arabic numerals in red ink, upper left recto.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written primarily in styles of nastaʻlīq in black or red ink; pointed.

decoNote: Numerous illustrations and calligraphic examples with floral borders; page openings with content are frame-ruled in black or red.

binding.p: Bound in plain brown leather (Type III).

origin.p: Item is undated, but likely copied in the 19th century. The colophon states that the author and calligrapher is Fadwá Gulāb Rāʼī, an inhabitant of Tajganj [Agra], and a student at the Madrasah of Sarkar Faiz East India Company (Angrez Bahadur) (f. 42r). Probably the Agra College, founded in 1823.

provenance: Gift of Alexander I. Cotheal (library bookplate inside front cover).
Formerly owned by Alexander I. Cotheal (stamp f. 1r, 42v).
